abstracts.cdata!:
The project rating is satisfactory, and
            substantial objectives were met, mainly regarding
            institutional development. However, the perception by
            investors on the country's risks, and the limited
            capacities at the early stages of the project, affected
            implementation, and outcome. But sustainability is very
            likely, and both the Bank, and the Borrower's
            performances were highly satisfactory. Lessons drawn from
            the project, suggest that multidimensional programs, require
            political considerations, in synergy with the technical
            work, to be supported by commitments at the highest level of
            Government, to ensure successful privatization programs. The
            government provided this commitment, and allowed time to
            evaluate options, and consultations with stakeholders, as
            well as ways to resolve complex privatization issues.
            However, specific policies, and actions for private sector
            development should be closely linked, but it appears that
            the Government gave priority to the pace of divestiture, and
            to revenue maximization, over the objective of broadening
            local share ownership, somehow preventing complete success
            of the privatization process. Nonetheless, institutional
            strengthening played a key role in the privatization
            program, and debt management, due to the work of a highly
            selected team, and the right training. Legislation, and
            related reforms should be established to attract foreign investments.
